intro: Alaticaulia helgae, commonly known as the sandhill lily, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and striking, showy flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its reproductive strategy involves producing small, capsule-like fruits that disperse seeds via wind. Alaticaulia helgae plays an important ecological role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing nectar for pollinators.
